subtitle: Apricots and pine nuts are mixed with minced lamb in this tasty dish.

method.text: Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the onions, garlic and pine nuts. Fry together for 3 min or until just beginning to colour.
Transfer to a bowl. Mix in the lamb, seasoning, coriander, apricots, raisins and enough beaten egg to bind to a firm but not too sticky mixture.
In a bowl, sift together the spice and flour with the Parmesan. Divide the lamb mixture into small balls and roll each lightly in the flour mixture.
Roll the meatballs in the breadcrumbs, shaking off any excess. Heat enough oil in a frying pan to just cover the base.
Cook the meatballs a few at a time in the pan for 8-10 min, stirring frequently until well browned and cooked thoroughly.
To make the sauce: Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the garlic, chilli powder and onion and fry for 2-3 min or until softened.
Add the tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce and seasoning to the pan. Bring to the boil and simmer for 8 min or until thickened slightly.
Drain the kofta balls on kitchen paper and keep warm while cooking the remainder.
Serve the kofta balls immediately with the tomato sauce.

title: Fruit and nut kofta balls
